attributes.action: Honour aerospace engineers Whittle Roe Camm with statues in prominent locations
attributes.additional_details: Now is the time to rightly retire a select few out of date statues to museums and replace them with recent world class giants of the technology and aerospace industry. A review will need to consider the credentials of statues both outgoing and incoming for location and impact applicable to messaging the UK strategic industrial goals as we seek a new independent trading status around the globe.
attributes.background: After legitimate review of statues in prominent positions in London, Bristol and other large cities and some retired to museums a confident and modern Great Britain should properly celebrate the very best aerospace engineers prominently so everyone can aspire to success in UK science and technology.

rejection.details:
Decisions about individual historical monuments, statues, plaques and street names are a matter for the local authority in which they are located and private landowners, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you want to raise concerns about a particular historical monument or statue or request the erection of a new statue you should contact your local authority about this.

The Local Government Association has published an advice note to help councils work to ensure all sections of the community feel heard by decision-makers and each other: https://www.local.gov.uk/topics/community-safety/statues
